title: 105_hr2949
content: The Missouri and Middle Mississippi Rivers Enhancement Project is outlined in Section 1. In this section, definitions for terms like "middle Mississippi River" and "Missouri River" are provided. The term "project" refers to the project authorized in this section, and the "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Army. Protection and enhancement activities are outlined, including the development of a plan within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Secretary must develop a plan within 180 days to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River without adversely affecting water-related needs. The plan must include modification and improvement of navigation training structures, creation of side channels, restoration of island fish and wildlife habitat, and creation of riverine fish habitat. The plan includes modification of navigation training structures, creation of side channels, restoration of island and riverine fish and wildlife habitat, prioritizing activities based on cost-effectiveness and success likelihood, and monitoring project success. The Secretary will implement these activities using available funds. The Secretary will design and construct project features to protect fish and wildlife habitat of the Missouri River or the middle Mississippi River, using existing funds and authority. The Secretary will integrate activities with other Federal and State activities in carrying out the project for mitigation of fish and wildlife losses. This section does not affect existing authority for the Missouri River Bank Stabilization and Navigation Project. The Navigation Project in Missouri, Kansas, Iowa, and Nebraska is authorized by various sections of the Water Resources Development Act of 1986. The section does not confer new regulatory authority on any entity carrying out activities under it. Public participation is required in developing and implementing the plan. The Secretary must ensure public participation and compliance with applicable laws in developing and carrying out the plan for the Navigation Project. Compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act is required. Cost sharing involves a non-Federal share of the cost. The Navigation Project requires compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act and cost sharing, with the non-Federal share not exceeding 25%. The Federal share for activities is capped at $5,000,000, with operation and maintenance being a Federal responsibility. $50,000,000 is authorized for appropriations from 1999 to 2004, managed by the Mississippi Valley Division. From 1999 to 2004, $50,000,000 is authorized for appropriations for the Navigation Project. Funds will be managed by the Mississippi Valley Division of the Army Corps of Engineers and distributed to the appropriate Districts.
